newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: WEAKER NZ DOLLAR PRESSURES DEBT MARKETS AT CLOSE.
newsitem.headline: WEAKER NZ DOLLAR PRESSURES DEBT MARKETS AT CLOSE.

text.p: Figures in brackets compare against previous trading day's close
RBNZ MCI NZ/MCI 707.49 (PREV 732.42) Reuters NZ MCI-117 vs -92
But weakness in the Australian dollar may act to further undermine the local currency.
Furthermore, renewed weakness in the Asian currencies may unleash another round of selling for the Kiwi.
By 0515 GMT the Kiwi had fallen to US$0.6372/79 from its 0.6420 local open and the Trade-Weighted Index dropped to 63.77 from 64.21.
The Monetary Conditions Index fell to minus 117 basis points from 92.
Weakness in the debt markets was currency-related and the impact was most pronounced in the short end, where September bank bill futures reversed earlier gains to end eight points down at 91.74.
Yields on February 2001 bonds rose to 7.28 from 7.26 percent while the 11/06s gained to 7.15 from 7.12.
Dealers expected a US$0.6365-0.6400 range to contain the Kiwi overnight.
